reviews.review_msg: Dawn was an amazing professor, her lectures were engaging, making the content easy to learn, especially during an intersession course. The assignment was well related to the content and was fun to do. She provided very clear instructions, making it easy to do assignments. The exams were not too difficult as long as you make sure to attend class.
tutorials were mostly group based, powerpoint were lacking information, get ready for reading the textbook

Exams are closely related to the textbook and videos/cases discussed in class so make sure to get some reading in and pay attention. Tutorials were not bad, they're just based on your participation and attendance. The grading for the paper and other written assignments were tough.

This prof did not know what was going on in the class she taught.. she didn't know certain dates or when our exam would be, but it was on the SFU site. Showed many youtube videos, then quizzed on the videos rather than actually teaching. This class itself was easy, but get ready, this prof makes it hard to understand simple topics, and yaps a lot.

(this is for crim 485) AMAZING she truly does everything in her power to make sure all her students succeed and the course itself has so much important information for the workplace highly recommend taking crim485 with her if you can!

Despite being the most caring and knowledgeable professor, she gives so much homework. Students must read 30 pages of the textbook every week and write a paper about the concept. Every three weeks you have a quiz based on three chapters. Major assignment on a case study. The exams are difficult. TAs are the worse. Took marks off and can not read

Fav prof at SFU. Took multiple classes taught by her in the Spring and had Marjan as my TA (she was brilliant). Paper is straight forward, tutorials are helpful and prof is passionate. Have nothing but good things to say about her. Helpful and understanding and lectures are insightful. Midterm and final is simple, mcq and short answers.

I've taken a couple classes with Dawn before and it's clear that she's a very caring professor. However, for CRIM 321 the grading criteria seemed to be unnecessarily harsh. On the exams, there were several trick questions and many marks were taken off of the written section for "missing parts" that were out of the scope of the question.

I didn't take Dawn for any crim classes but she was my field placement coordinator and she was the most supportive, caring, and helpful faculty member I've ever interacted with at SFU. She truly is a blessing during a process so anxiety inducing and intimidating. If you're considering taking field placement know that Dawn has your back!

Dawn is an amazing professor who really cares about her students. Her lectures are recorded, but her lecture slides barely had any content so you need go/listen to the lecture. Others say this class is textbook heavy but I barely read it and still got an A. She uses a lot of IRL examples which were helpful to understand the main topics. Good class!
the grading criteria is very unclear. like who curves down bro

I have nothing but good things to say. The class was taught well, never too much information at once IMO. The textbook is free and the chapters are not too long. Tutorial grades are released every week so you know where you stand. Grading is fair and midterms/finals are exactly what she said they would be. If you put in effort, you will be fine.

Dawn has good lectures but do take notes. Read the textbook and take notes but chapters aren't long so its not that bad. Exams aren't too bad if you keep up with the material. Written questions have a pretty specific grading criteria so be careful of that. Tutorial material will also be on exams but its not hard stuff. Course itself is not hard.

Dawn is a great professor. The lectures were content heavy and you definitely needed to show up but the lectures were actually interesting. Easy material to study. The textbook was annoying accessibility wise but it was free and not terribly long per chapter. Perfect elective or GPA booster for sure.

One of the better profs, top 3 for sure. Super clear, super organized, taught the material really well. If u pay attention to lecture and the readings, you can easily score pretty high. Midterm is exactly what she said would be. Her lectures are aligned w the textbook chapters so it's pretty easy to catch up if you missed anything.Textbook is FREE!

Dawn is a nice prof it's just a pretty slow class in my opinion. You definitely need to read the textbook because the whole exam is based on it. Then she'll just pull the random examples from lecture on the exams. Not really sure how that helps with the content learning. Boring lectures, and the TA is horrible.

Dawn is an amazing professor. Her tests are heavily based off textbook, so you HAVE to read it. Her lecture slides didn't have much on them so it kinda forced you to go to lecture. She is really good at giving personal examples but you need to learn how to put 2 and 2 together by yourself. Overall, she is a very kind with amazing communication!

One of the best professors I've had. Syllabus and grading is super clear, lectures were a little boring but as long as you find a way to keep up with the material (e.g. textbook), it was easy to succeed in this class. No trick questions or tough grading.

Dr. Rault was an interesting lecturer who had well-laid out lectures and clear rubrics. We had one reflection, one midterm, one paper, and one final exam. The participation in tutorials are important, but the lectures are recorded, so attendance isn't necessary. Also used an open access textbook, so we didn't have to pay. Highly recommend.

Dawn is a great professor. Going to lectures and tutorials helps a lot. since her slides don't make sense if you just read them and she usually does go more in-depth in class. She's very clear with grading criteria and what will be in the tests. Also, you have to read the textbook since that's mostly what her tests are based on

You have to read the textbook. Lectures are just captured with additional examples, tutorials are pretty engaging. But watch out for midterms and finals, as the wording sometimes is different so you HAVE to know to material well enough, memorization will not be enough always. Overall, good lectures, nice workload, and caring prof,

To be honest she seems great and knows what she is talking about, but when you are trying to review her lecture slides, they do not make any sense. SHe also expects you to read the textbook which is fine but I hate how I learn more from reading the textbook than actually listening to her lectures.

Her lecture slides are very minimal, you'll need to read the textbook quite a bit. She doesn't do any exam prep or at least tell us key terms which made studying kinda hard. Her assignments are not too difficult but attendance is important if you want to do well.

Though she barely puts stuff in her slides, making it more information from textbook-based rather than slides, she is a great lecturer! She simplifies confusing concepts, and her tests are straightforward as she goes over the test formats before exam day. The tutorial videos and readings are always on the tests but it is mostly textbook based.

Professor canceled all her lectures, due to TA strikes. all my other profs continue class but i havent had a lecture in this class in over a month. I understand that shes respecting pickets. but complete lack of communication just makes it seem like we are falling further and further behind. I payed for these classes but they dont exist.

Not the best lecturer, but a super kind and respectful individual. Dawn cares about her students, and responds to emails and concerns quickly. Papers have clear instructions and grading criteria, exams are pretty straightforward.

Lectures are just discussions between students - there's barely anything on her slides because she wants you to learn form the textbook - so there's a lot of reading ... Haven't taken the tests yet or done any assignments, but I already hate her teaching method

I really like the prof who is passionate about criminology. Unfortunately, her TAs are tough graders and they'll make sure your grade is as low as possible. You will get 2/3 for incorrectly responding to one out of ten parts of the question. Exams on the written portion are extremely difficult. TAs expect you to write like a lawyer. Avoid taking it

the TAs are absolutely terrible; they pay attention to the smallest details. very standoffish, on exams, if u miss one thing out of a 5 point q, you're gonna get a 0. do not take this class; they literally set u up to fail over small things, point itty bitty details and then when u fix it, they give u the same mark. teacher's the same.

The TAs are extremely awful! They are too detailed on small things and take marks off whenever possible. I regret taking this class with this professor because the TAs are shi*. I got A in every low division of crim classes except for this one. TAs are not helpful at all. They should be trained properly.

took this after everyone said she was good, yeah, no. accuses you of stuff you never did, stand-offish, and passive-aggressive when u try to talk and explain. thought it would be a nice class but she def ruined my mood every week, TA was too detailed oriented and gave sh*t for every small thing and took marks off. exams were medium difficult, 6/10.

A lot of work (multiple assign including an annotated bibliography, letter, + major assignment) but they all fit together. If you keep up with your assignments/readings=manageable. Spend the time on your annotated bib as you'll use it for your other assignments. Rault is knowledgeable/fair. Exams on the harder side. Liked the advocacy letter.

Dawn is very kind and a great teacher. Course covers many theories and is a lot of writing. Exams are reasonable but you have to know the theories well. Written exam qs based on examples in lecture and mc based on textbook. 1 major essay, 2 small writing projects, deliverables, midterm and final (non-cumulative). Feels like a sociology course.

Rault is a great prof but her exams for this class were pretty tough. This class consisted of an annotated bib, an advocacy letter, a major assignment, a midterm, tutorial participation, and a final. Her final, IMO, was very unfair as the short answer portion required cumulative knowledge when she said that exam was non-cumulative.

You need to read and take notes on the textbook material, the exams are heavily based on it and the examples in lectures are critical to remember as well. Overall Dawn Rault is a kind and passionate professor.

Dawn is a good prof and made 8:30am class more interesting. Textbooks and lectures are important. The term paper was alright. I found the short answer not as fair for the exams. TA's will be huge in this class. Krystina was AMAZING and so understanding. TRY AND GET HER IF POSSIBLE. Show up and try and you will be fine.

Dawn was an amazing prof. She made the lecture so engaging and was ready to explain anything you don't understand. Her exams are MC and short answers, textbook and lecture-based. I found that the MC was easier but the short answer was hard and unfair. TA will make or break grade. The term paper is difficult but doable. Spent 6h in court for it. rip

the midterm and final were extremely difficult. the mc portion was alright but the written responses were hard because it covered a broad range of topics. was told we didn't need to memorize anything from the charter of rights by the TA but turns out we did so...

TA's will make or break your grade!

Rault kept the lectures engaging and often allowed for significant in-lecture participation. The class consisted of an annotated bib, major paper, tutorial participation, reflection assignment, and a final exam. Be sure to keep up on the readings and go to tutorial as they help a lot!! The final was a little difficult IMO so review lecture and text
An awesome semester :) Loved the class and everything about it!

Trash instructor that should have stayed in Alberta. Unclear assignments, unclear grading. Does not grade fairly. Will ask for a review of her before providing graded assignments which is not fair. Unwilling to accommodate. On the other side, the TA, Krystina was great, the instructor however, is awful.

Dawn is the best prof at SFU! There are not enough good things to say about Dawn, her class is very minimal work and she marks very easily. This was supposed to be a writing-heavy course but in my opinion, I did not have to write a lot at all. She is amazing and she is also super sweet! 10/10 would recommend taking her course!
